policy: ALL tasks and subtasks contained within this blueprint MUST be completed in their entirety. Deferring, skipping, or omitting any part of the plan is strictly prohibited. Every unit defined here represents a mandatory component of final delivery. 'Effective test coverage' means covering ALL code paths, edge cases, and error conditions - not just line coverage. This includes unreachable paths, error branches, and platform-specific code.

coverageDefinition.effectiveCoverage: Coverage of all logic paths, error branches, edge cases, and platform-specific code. Must handle null/undefined inputs, error propagation, concurrent access, and boundary conditions.

targetMetrics.errorPathCoverage: 100% not inclusive of TRULY unreachable code i.e. invariant assertions

tasks.title: Create promisealtfour variant to represent Main promise implementation
tasks.description: Create a new ./internal/promisealtfour/ directory and implement the current Main ChainedPromise logic as a variant. This ensures tournament fidelity preservation by having the Main implementation represented both directly (for evolution) and as a tournament variant (for performance comparison tracking). The Main implementation will remain the primary eventloop promise, but promisealtfour will serve as a frozen snapshot for tournament comparison.
tasks.critical: Create ./internal/promisealtfour/ directory structure with promise.go, ingress.go, loop.go
Port current Main ChainedPromise implementation to promisealtfour with variant-specific packaging
Create promisealtfour variant registry entry in tournament system
Add promisealtfour to all tournament competition scenarios
Document the implementation with clear differentiation from Main

acceptanceCriteria: promisealtfour code builds without errors or warnings
All promisealtfour tests pass with -race detector
promisealtfour successfully participates in tournament events
promisealtfour produces consistent performance metrics in tournament runs
Main implementation continues to work independently without interference
Tournament results show promisealtfour competing alongside existing variants

tasks.title: Verify ALL tournament checks pass and compete successfully
tasks.description: Run comprehensive tournament validation to ensure ALL promise variants (main, alternateone, alternatetwo, alternatethree, promisealtfour) participate fairly in all tournament events. This includes functional correctness tests, performance benchmarks, stress tests, and race condition detection across all variants. Verify tournament integrity, fairness, and consistency of results across multiple runs.
deliverables: Execute all tournament tests across all 5 variants (main, alt1, alt2, alt3, alt4)
Verify each variant successfully competes in all tournament scenarios
Validate tournament fairness and consistency across 10+ runs
Document any issues discovered during validation with detailed analysis
Create tournament competition matrix showing all variant performance
Verify no variant fails catastrophically or degrades unfairly
acceptanceCriteria: All tournament tests pass for ALL 5 variants
No variant fails to compete in any scenario
Tournament results are consistent across multiple runs (low variance)
No unfair advantages or disadvantages detected in any variant
Performance rankings are stable and reproducible
All edge cases (null inputs, deep chains, concurrent access) pass

tasks.title: Analyze promisealtone performance characteristics for Main migration
tasks.description: Perform deep performance analysis of the promisealtone variant to identify the key optimizations and patterns that make it the most performant implementation. Document all critical optimizations including memory allocation patterns, synchronization strategies, cache layout, and algorithmic choices. Create a detailed migration plan outlining which optimizations to apply to the Main promise implementation.
deliverables: Detailed benchmark comparison of promisealtone vs all other variants (main, alt2, alt3, alt4)
Comprehensive analysis document identifying specific optimization patterns in promisealtone
Identification of performance-critical optimizations (e.g., reduced allocations, lock-free paths)
Migration plan document with risk assessment and incremental rollout strategy
Performance baseline measurements for before/after comparison
acceptanceCriteria: Benchmark results are reproducible across 10+ runs (low variance)
Optimization patterns are clearly documented with code examples and rationale
Migration plan is actionable and technically sound with fallback strategies
No regressions detected in other variants during analysis
Performance differential between promisealtone and other variants is quantified

tasks.title: Refactor Main promise implementation using promisealtone optimizations
tasks.description: Apply the identified optimizations from promisealtone to the Main ChainedPromise implementation in eventloop/promise.go while maintaining 100% API compatibility. This may involve: (1) Memory allocation pattern changes, (2) Synchronization strategy improvements, (3) Cache line layout optimizations, (4) Algorithmic improvements, (5) Data structure changes. Maintain backward compatibility at the source code level.
deliverables: Refactored Main promise with promisealtone optimizations applied
Updated promisealtfour variant to track changes in Main (maintain baseline)
Full API compatibility maintained (no breaking changes to public API)
Updated documentation reflecting all optimization changes
Migration commit with clear changelog and justification
acceptanceCriteria: All existing tests pass with no regressions
-race detector shows zero data races in refactored code
Benchmark performance shows improvement over baseline (target: +5%+)
API compatibility tests confirm no breaking changes (type signatures unchanged)
Code review confirms optimizations match promisealtone patterns
promisealtfour variant remains unchanged (preserves tournament baseline)

tasks.title: Performance regression testing after Main promise migration
tasks.description: Comprehensive performance testing to ensure the refactored Main promise meets or exceeds previous performance benchmarks, maintains fairness in tournament competition, and that all variants continue to compete fairly. Run extended benchmarks (10+ iterations) across multiple scenarios including: microbenchmarks, realistic workloads, stress tests, and tournament scenarios.
deliverables: Comprehensive before/after benchmark comparison report
Tournament competition results with refactored Main
Performance metrics analysis with statistical significance testing
Any necessary performance tuning adjustments
Stability assessment (no performance anomalies in edge cases)
acceptanceCriteria: No performance regressions in Main promise (within measurement noise)
Main promise performance approaches or exceeds promisealtone (target: <5% variance)
All 5 variants (main, alt1, alt2, alt3, alt4) compete fairly in tournament
Response times are stable (low variance across runs)
Throughput is improved or maintained across realistic workloads
No memory leaks or allocation increases detected

tasks.title: Add comprehensive tests for JS integration error paths
tasks.description: Create comprehensive tests covering all uncovered error paths in js.go and ingress.go identified in coverage analysis. Focus on: (1) Ingress error conditions and double-check paths, (2) JS promise integration error handling, (3) Concurrent error scenarios, (4) Invalid input handling, (5) Error propagation through the event loop. These are the final critical coverage gaps needed to reach 90% coverage target.
deliverables: Test file: eventloop/js_integration_error_paths_test.go (20+ tests)
Test file: eventloop/ingress_error_paths_test.go (15+ tests)
Comprehensive coverage of all previously uncovered error paths
Zero data races detected with -race flag
All new tests integrated into test suite with proper documentation
acceptanceCriteria: All new tests pass
Coverage analysis shows significant reduction in uncovered lines (target: <10% uncovered)
No data races detected (-race clean)
Estimated coverage gain: +3-5% towards 90% target
Main eventloop coverage increases from 84.6% to target 90%+
Error paths in js.go and ingress.go are fully exercised

tasks.title: Complete eventloop module to 90%+ coverage
tasks.description: Run final comprehensive coverage analysis for the entire eventloop module and add any necessary additional tests to reach the target metrics: main >= 90%, alternateone >= 90%, alternatethree >= 85%, alternatetwo >= 90%. Verify that all code paths, error branches, edge cases, and platform-specific code are covered. Add tests for any remaining gaps identified.
deliverables: Final coverage profile: go test -coverprofile=coverage.out ./eventloop/... && go tool cover -html=coverage.out -o coverage.html
Coverage analysis document with metrics per package and variant
Any additional test files for remaining coverage gaps (if any)
Verification that all target metrics are achieved
Coverage report uploaded and made available for review
acceptanceCriteria: main coverage >= 90%
alternateone coverage >= 90%
alternatethree coverage >= 85% (experimental)
alternatetwo coverage >= 90%
All tests pass with -race flag
No unreachable critical code paths remain uncovered
Coverage report clearly shows all covered and uncovered lines

This is Phase 1 of goja-eventloop coverage improvement targeting the highest-impact gaps.

goja-eventloop coverage increases from 74.0% toward 90% target

tasks.title: Add combinator edge case tests for goja-eventloop
tasks.description: Create comprehensive edge case tests for Promise combinators (Promise.all, Promise.race, Promise.allSettled, Promise.any) focusing on: null/undefined inputs, array edge cases, empty arrays, mixed resolution/rejection scenarios, and deeply nested promises. This is Phase 2 of goja-eventloop coverage improvement.

Coverage of all combinator edge cases and error conditions

tasks.title: Add timer edge case tests for goja-eventloop
tasks.description: Create comprehensive timer ID boundary tests for goja-eventloop focusing on: MAX_SAFE_INTEGER limits, overflow scenarios, ID reuse edge cases, concurrent timer scheduling with high IDs, and timer cleanup scenarios. This is Phase 3 of goja-eventloop coverage improvement.

Coverage of all timer ID boundary conditions and concurrent scenarios

tasks.title: Complete goja-eventloop module to 90%+ coverage
tasks.description: Run final comprehensive coverage analysis for the goja-eventloop module and add any necessary additional tests to reach the target metric: main >= 90%. tasks.title: Re-verify Goja-Eventloop Integration against main branch
tasks.description: Comprehensive re-verification review of the Goja-Eventloop Integration (LOGICAL_CHUNK_1) against the current main branch to ensure no regressions from eventloop core changes and Main promise refactoring in T1-T5. This is a MAXIMUM PARANOIA review following the established pattern from previous review cycles.
deliverables: Comprehensive review document: ./goja-eventloop/docs/reviews/41-LOGICAL1_REVERIFICATION.md
Detailed analysis of all changes vs main branch
Succinct summary (must be optimal, removing any part would degrade)
Detailed findings with specific line references and issue identification
Actionable fix recommendations for any issues found
acceptanceCriteria: Review is thorough and questions ALL information (MAXIMUM PARANOIA)
Only trusts information that is impossible to verify
Review follows strict format requirements (succinct summary + detailed analysis)
Findings are actionable and well-documented with specific code references
No critical issues remain unidentified
Assessment of risk and confidence is clearly stated

tasks.title: Fix all issues found in Goja-Eventloop re-verification
tasks.description: Address ALL issues found in T12 re-verification review comprehensively. This includes: fixing any bugs, addressing any race conditions, optimizing any performance issues, handling any edge cases, and resolving any API inconsistencies. Use runSubagent or direct implementation as appropriate. Every single issue must be resolved before proceeding.
deliverables: All identified issues fixed comprehensively with root cause resolution
All affected tests updated or added (regression tests)
All fixes verify with -race detector (zero data races)
Documentation updated as necessary (comments, docs, changelogs)
Verification that no new issues are introduced by fixes
acceptanceCriteria: All tests pass including new regression tests for each fix
Zero data races detected across entire goja-eventloop module
No new issues introduced by the fixes (no regressions)
All original issues identified in T12 are resolved
Fixes are minimal and targeted (avoid over-engineering)
Code review confirms fixes address root causes not symptoms

tasks.title: Verify Goja-Eventloop to perfection
tasks.description: Re-review the Goja-Eventloop Integration after T13 fixes ensuring UTTER PERFECTION is achieved. If ANY issues remain, restart the T12, T13, T14 cycle (review, fix, re-verify) until the verdict is PERFECT with zero remaining issues. This cycle continues until the module is verified to be production-ready with absolutely no outstanding concerns.
deliverables: Perfection review document: ./goja-eventloop/docs/reviews/42-LOGICAL1_PERFECTION.md
Final verdict: PERFECT or continuation of review-fix-reverify cycle
Documentation of all review cycle iterations if multiple passes needed
Final assessment of production readiness
acceptanceCriteria: Verdict is PERFECT with no remaining issues
MAXIMUM PARANOIA review shows zero concerns
No regressions introduced in any iteration
Review document satisfies all format requirements
Confidence assessment: PRODUCTION READY
All review cycles from previous work remain valid (no new issues introduced)

tasks.title: Final comprehensive cross-module integration testing
tasks.description: Run comprehensive integration tests across both eventloop and goja-eventloop modules to ensure all optimizations, refactoring, and coverage improvements work together correctly. This includes: cross-module scenario tests, full-stack integration tests, tournament competition across all variants, and stress testing of the complete system. This is the final validation before production readiness.
deliverables: Cross-module integration test results (all tests pass)
Performance analysis across both modules showing no regressions
Tournament results with all optimizations applied (all 5 variants compete)
Final production readiness assessment with risk analysis
Integration test coverage report
acceptanceCriteria: All cross-module integration tests pass

Performance improvements verified across both modules
Zero data races detected in comprehensive testing (-race clean)
Both modules meet 90%+ coverage targets

Stress tests show no failures or unexpected behavior

tasks.title: Final benchmark validation and documentation
tasks.description: Run a final comprehensive benchmark suite to quantify all performance improvements, document all optimizations made, and create final production-ready documentation for both modules. This includes before/after comparisons, optimization rationales, performance characteristics of all variants, user-facing documentation updates, and clear documentation of any trade-offs made.
deliverables: Comprehensive benchmark report comparing before/after for all variants
Optimization documentation for Main promise migration (T4)
Performance characteristics document for all tournament variants
Production readiness summary with clear recommendations

Documentation is clear, actionable, and technically accurate

tasks.description: Run the final comprehensive verification suite on both macOS and linux-container platforms to ensure everything builds, passes tests, passes vet, staticcheck, betteralign, and that all 200+ tests pass with zero failures across both eventloop and goja-eventloop modules. This is the final gate before declaring the feature branch production-ready for merge.

Test results across all modules and variants (200+ tests, 100% pass rate)

Final production readiness sign-off document
Merge readiness checklist verification

tasks.title: Identify next trajectory targets
tasks.description: COMPLETED (2026-01-29) - Cycle 2 review completed with 57 high-value improvement opportunities identified. CRITICAL and HIGH priority improvements defined as T19-T24 (Structured Logging, Integration Test Expansion, Metrics Export, Goja Timeout Guards, Batch Execution Timeout). Production readiness confirmed with 96-97% confidence across 4 MAXIMUM PARANOIA reviews. Trajectory of improvement is maintained with clear Phase 1 and Phase 2 targets.

Formal commitment to continuous improvement cycle sustained

Continuous improvement trajectory maintained with clear T25 final sign-off goal
No cessation of development activity - work continues through T25

tasks.title: Structured Logging Implementation
tasks.description: Create a comprehensive structured logging system for the eventloop module that provides a Logger interface with multiple implementations (DefaultLogger, WriterLogger, NoOpLogger, FileLogger), log level filtering (DEBUG, INFO, WARN, ERROR) with lazy evaluation, package-level logging functions (SDebug, SInfo, SWarn, SError), functional options (WithLoopID, WithTaskID, WithTimerID, WithField, WithFields), and domain-specific helpers for timer, promise, task, microtask, and poll logging. Enable log aggregation and production monitoring with proper error handling and JSON escaping.
tasks.implementationDetails: 684-line logging.go with 454-line test suite, 21 tests passing, full Logger interface, level filtering, lazy evaluation, package-level functions, functional options, domain-specific helpers, thread-safe
tasks.testResults: 21 tests PASSED in 0.570s, verified: Logger interface (DefaultLogger, WriterLogger, NoOpLogger, FileLogger), level filtering, lazy evaluation, package-level functions, functional options, domain-specific helpers, thread safety, JSON escaping, context integration
deliverables: Create eventloop/logging.go (684 lines) - comprehensive structured logging interface
Create eventloop/logging_test.go (454 lines) - 21 comprehensive tests
Logger interface with 4 implementations: DefaultLogger, WriterLogger, NoOpLogger, FileLogger
Log level filtering system (DEBUG, INFO, WARN, ERROR) with lazy evaluation
Package-level logging functions: SDebug, SInfo, SWarn, SError
Functional options: WithLoopID, WithTaskID, WithTimerID, WithField, WithFields
Domain-specific helpers: timer, promise, task, microtask, poll logging
Thread-safe concurrent logging with proper synchronization
Production-ready error handling and JSON escaping
acceptanceCriteria: All 21 tests pass (verified: 0.570s execution time)
Logger interface fully implemented with 4 working implementations
Log level filtering works correctly (DEBUG < INFO < WARN < ERROR)
Lazy evaluation prevents unnecessary string formatting
Package-level functions (SDebug, SInfo, SWarn, SError) work correctly
Functional options allow flexible field and ID composition
Domain-specific helpers provide contextual logging for all eventloop components
Thread safety verified by concurrent logging test (1000 goroutines)
Error handling catches and reports file I/O errors
JSON escaping prevents log injection vulnerabilities
Zero data races detected with -race flag
Code is production-ready with comprehensive error handling

continuousVerification.task: Run 'make all' with full logging after EVERY significant change
continuousVerification.description: Execute 'make all 2>&1 | fold -w 200 | tee build.log | tail -n 15' after: (a) Each code change, (b) Each test addition, (c) Each task completion, (d) Each bug fix, (e) Each review cycle. This is a CONTINUOUS task that must be executed throughout the entire plan without exception.
continuousVerification.failPolicy: If ANY test fails, STOP IMMEDIATELY and fix the issue before proceeding. Zero tolerance for test failures, timing issues, non-determinism, or race conditions. Do not skip, defer, or ignore any test failure.

reviewCycle2.summary: Comprehensive review vs HEAD completed with MAXIMUM PARANOIA. Zero critical issues found.
